meanings.definition: Not able to be afforded or paid for.
meanings.sent1: The expensive car was unaffordable for most people.
meanings.sent2: The house was unaffordable for the young couple.
meanings.sent3: The idea of buying a private jet was unaffordable for a pizza delivery guy.
meanings.sent4: Dreaming of a vacation on Mars was unaffordable even for the wealthiest.
meanings.sent5: The diamond-encrusted watch was so unaffordable that it seemed like a fantasy.

meanings.sent1: The designer handbag was unaffordable for the average shopper.
meanings.sent2: The luxurious yacht was unaffordable for the middle-class family.
meanings.sent3: Trying to buy a private island was unaffordable for a lemonade stand owner.
meanings.sent4: The mansion on the hill was unaffordable, like a castle in a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The rare painting was so unaffordable that it felt like a treasure beyond reach.
